ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Patch Message
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh..yeah, I tend to make that assumption.  Dunno how accurate (or inaccurate) that assumption is. I ll just make a macro: /w all bard count /w all darkfox
ygData.messageBody:
Heh..yeah, I tend to make that assumption. Dunno how accurate (or
inaccurate) that assumption is.

I'll just make a macro:
/w all bard count
/w all darkfox

...and do the math accordingly. Hehee!

Shoot me a tell sometime, if ya want. If you're around level 30, I'd love
to group. I've always wanted to have another bard in the group that knew
enough about the songs and how to twist to coordinate a 6 song crescendo of
power that NONE CAN WITHSTAND..MWHAHAHAHAA!

Oh, sorry...heh...I've grouped with bards from time to time, and I can see
where a lot of the misconceptions and plain ignorance comes from. Even had
one, no matter how many times we "agreed" on what songs we'd play, he'd end
up playing hymn and anthem only...anthem when fighting, hymn when not.
/sigh

Atonal

-----Original Message-----
From: blitz_krieg@... [mailto:blitz_krieg@...]
Sent: Monday, February 26, 2001 2:42 PM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [eqbards] Re: Patch Message


> I would say a bard count is infinitely more accurate than say a
wizard or druid count.

Possibly, but you're assuming that the only reason someone will go
anon/roleplay is to avoid people asking them for the services that
their class can provide. It's not the only reason present and it's
hard to say if it's the most common reason or not. Many Hate/Fear
raids, for example, ask that everyone goes Anon/RP so they don't get
raid crashers. i.e. People would do a /w all 50 55 and if a lot of
people showed up in Hate, then they'd know it was safe to port up.

And, btw, that 74 count on Xegony more than likely missed me, since I
usually play during primetime and have been on Roleplay since they
introduced the ability. It's all those damn stalkers. :)

Darkfox
Xegony
